column4: this is what I get when I try to boot with linux-image-2.6.8.1-3-686: Kernel panic: VFS: Unable to mount root fs on unknown-block (0,0)
sounds like the initrd wasn't set up
yeah, it does
I just did apt-get install
yes
if you're using grub, I think you need to make sure that all the requisite options are in the commented # kopt line in menu.lst, otherwise update-grub doesn't know what options to put in
for now try booting with root=/dev/hda1 or wherever it actually is
I'll try to install itagain, it might have been fixed since yesterday I guess...
and in other case try the root-option
the kopt looks fine
and the root too
do you know anything about when ubuntu-calender-november will appear?
I thought it already had
hm... weirdness...
note that addressing individual developers about stuff you don't know to be in their sphere of interest is generally a bad idea, though :)
I think it's in warty-updates, which may not be in your sources.list by default
yeah, I know, sorry
oh, thanks for the tip
doh
it's not the default
it's not even the one called Human circle of friends? How can I install it?
that's the right one, the thumbnail's just wrong (last-minute glitch)
oh, that's why, thanks a lot
